Description: Amendments made to sub-rule (9) of rule 90 to add 'or grand parent' after 'natural guardian'. In Note 2 below rule 118, replaced 'his/her guardian' with 'his/her de-facto guardian' and added 'or grand parent' after 'natural guardian'. These amendments were made to address delays in payment of family pension and Death-cum-Retirement Gratuity/share to minor children through de-facto guardian, which had caused hardship to eligible minor children of deceased Government employees. This amendment gives statutory validity to G.O. (P) No. 381/2014/Fin., dated September 1, 2014.

In sub-rule (6): Items (j) and (k) omitted, Note 4 omitted, Note 5 modified to change '(d), (e), (g), (j) and (k)' to '(d), (e) and (g)', '(e), (g), (j) and (k)' to '(e) and (g)', and figures '15,000' to '30,000'.
In sub-rule (6A): Changed figures '15,000' to '30,000' in clause (1).
In sub-rule (7): Omitted word 'unmarried' in condition (i) of proviso.

Added new instruction 1A after instruction 1: 'Details as to whether the appointment is in merit quota or in reservation quota shall be entered in the Service Book while entering details of advice memo and appointment order'. This amendment gives statutory validity to G.O. (P) No. 125/2016/Fin. dated August 29, 2016.

In 'Note 10': Added new provisions regarding pension revision for those eligible for full pension (if revised pension is less than 50% of minimum revised scale pay, 50% shall be ensured) and for those not eligible for full pension (proportional amount based on qualifying service shall be ensured).
Added new 'Note 10A': Extended Note 10 benefits to employees with pre-revised pay in average emoluments due to LWA up to 4 months, except those who availed LWA under Appendix XII A, XII B and XII C.
Changed '7 lakhs' to '14 lakhs' in Rule 68.

In clause (4) of sub-rule (4CC): Changed '4,500' to '8,500' and '17,960' to '36,000'. In sub-rule (7), clause (b): Sub-clause (a) changed '50% of ₹59,840, viz; ₹29,920' to '50% of ₹1,20,000 viz; ₹60,000', Sub-clause (b) changed '30% of ₹59,840 viz; ₹17,960' to '30% of ₹1,20,000 viz; ₹36,000'.
In sub-rule (ii) of rule 77: Added 'leave connected to inquiry into sexual harassment' after 'child adoption leave'.

Added new Rule 102 C under new SECTION IX C - LEAVE CONNECTED TO INQUIRY INTO SEXUAL HARASSMENT. Provides leave up to 90 days for aggrieved female employees during sexual harassment inquiry, granted on recommendation of Internal/Local Complaints Committee, only during pendency of inquiry under Sexual Harassment Act, 2013, can be combined with other leaves except LWA under Appendix XII A/XII B/XII C, not debited against leave account, granted on full pay.

Added new sub-rule (d): 'An employee who had committed offences while in service and against whom disciplinary action has not initiated while in service or within the time limit stipulated under clause (ii) of sub-rule (b) of rule 3 and who had received pensionary benefits on the pretext of satisfactory service as per sub-rule (a) of this rule, action as per sub-rule (c) of this rule shall be initiated.'
In Note 5 to rule 62: Omitted the words 'scale of'.
In Note 2 to sub-rule (5) of rule 90: Omitted the words 'scale of'.
In clause(vi) of sub-rule (13): Changed 'Form 2' to 'Form 2B'.
Changed 'Form 11' to 'Form 2A'.
In sub-clause (ii) of clause (b): Changed 'Form 2' to 'Form 2B'.
In clause (b): Changed 'Form 2' to 'Form 2B'. In clause (c): Sub-clause (i) and (ii): Changed 'Form 2' to 'Form 2B'.
In sub-rule (1): Changed 'Form 2' to 'Form 2B'.
Added: 'If date of application for claim is within one year from the date of retirement, application for commutation of pension in Form 2A and 2B shall be furnished'.

Modified Form 2A as 'Formal application for Pension and Commutation'. Form includes application details for pension and commutation, personal information, retirement details, commutation preferences, treasury details, declarations, and required attachments.

Added new Form 2B as 'Formal application for Pension/Gratuity, Death-Cum Retirement Gratuity, Family Pension and Commutation of pension'. Form includes comprehensive application for multiple benefits, personal and service details, pension calculation details, treasury information, family details, declarations, and account enfacement details.
Omitted words 'extraordinary pension or' from Rule 88.
In sub-rule (11): Omitted words 'and Extraordinary pension admissible under the rules in Appendix XIII of Part III of this rule'.
Omitted words 'an injury or other extraordinary pension sanctioned under Appendix XIII to these rules and'.
In Ruling below rule 102: Added words 'awarded under the Defense Service Rules' between words 'pension' and 'should'.

Omitted Chapter VI and Appendix-XIII entirely. This change was made because other welfare schemes like Group Personal Accident Insurance Scheme and Ex gratia Payment were implemented, leading to the withdrawal of extraordinary pension scheme, except for Defense Service Rules related extraordinary pension.
Changed 'rupees Two' to 'rupees Two hundred and fifty' for duplicate Pension Payment Order fees.
Changed 'rupees Two hundred and fifty' to 'rupees Two hundred and sixty five' for duplicate Pension Payment Order fees.

Rule 31 and NOTE replaced with: Rule 31(a): Interruptions in service will not count for pension, with exception that regular service before interruption is eligible if period of interruption is condoned. Rule 31(b): Interruption due to strike treated as 'Dies-Non' shall count for pension. Government Decision No.8 below Rule 14E Part III KSRs deleted.
